message: Added miscellaneous_ex9: Example that demonstrates a discontinuity on an internal mesh interface  which requires the sparsity pattern to be augmented.
changes from running bootstrap for pthread api
actual code changes and additions for pthread api
Make objects in FEMContext private  forcing users to the use API that was finalized in #108.
adding ability to get unique id for pthreads
add in spin mutex specialization for osx
small fix for threading on linux
Note update on FEMContext public members going private.
Disable misc_ex9 when Exodus is disabled
misc_ex9 fixes for dof_id_type != unsigned int
Set subdomain id on sides built by Elem::build_side().
more robust m4 cruft  make sure enablepthreads gets turned off when AX_PTHREAD fails
metis relies on TLS  so invoke it.  required for --disable-tbb
rbOOmit change: Added subdomain dependency to RBParametrizedFunction  and propagated that change into the EIM code.
Re-applied weird regression of NEWS in 72dcf7d
rbOOmit change: Made argument const for consistency.
Updating publications web page for Aug 2013.
Bugfix in adjoint Dirichlet boundary resize
More  more robust Dirichlet boundary accessors
Starting to use adjoint BCs in sensitivity calcs
Updated threads.h to trigger thread safe useage of fparser
Adding simple support for copying elemental solutions from exodus files
Adding a check if exodus file was opened before calling copy_nodal_solution()
Use multiple lines (with line continuation characters) for macros in libmesh_common.h
Call MPI_Abort() from the terminate_handler() to take care of implementations which do not unwind the stack (and therefore never make it to the LibMeshInit destructor).

Checking if the file is "created" is overzealous.  It can be open without being created...  To be safer we should probably add a new flag  called _is_open  that gets set when you call ExodusII_IO_Helper::open()...
Added SerialMesh::stitch_surfaces to stitch adjacent surfaces on the same mesh.

Added N^2 node search option back into SerialMesh::stitch_meshes. This option is more robust in the case that we have tolerance issues that lead to less accurate alignment of the nodes that are to be stitched.
Added an extra error checking flag for the case where we expect the number of nodes on the stitched surface IDs to match
temporarily remove FP_USE_THREAD_SAFE_EVAL until adaptivity_ex5 works again.
Make copy_nodal/elemental_solution() fail with the same error whether you are using opt or debug mode.
Adding Krol preprint.  The DOI does not seem to be active yet.
Fixing an error in homemade remove_if algorithms.
Reformatting only (spacing  comments) patch for this very old code.
Removing getters for public data members in ExodusII_IO_Helper.
Use C++ data structures in ExodusII_IO_Helper::NamesData.

Use the NamesData object in the following ExodusII_IO_Helper routines: * get_nodal_var_names() * get_elemental_var_names() * initialize_element_variables() * initialize_nodal_variables() * initialize_global_variables()
Adding shape  first  and second derivative functions for 3D Nedelec One hex
Now supporting first order NEDELEC_ONE for HEX20 and HEX27
Make spacing consistent in for loops.
Removing apparently redundant calls to Exodus_IO_Helper::get_time_steps().
Output now can do 2D and 3D  not just 2D.
Generalize NamesData object to take a string length.
Bug fix for small dof_id_type size
One more set of size type fixes
Use a macro to check error codes in the Exodus reader.
Setting up a new example to exercise 3D Nedelec elements.
For consistency  make functions which read data from the Exodus file follow 2 conventions: .) Be called read_xyz() .) Return void
Adding vector_fe_ex3 and vector_fe_ex4 back into 'make check'.
Using direct solver for the vector FE examples.
Updating references: * Montagnier 2011 preprint * Dec thesis * Gunther 2011 conference paper * Steih  2012 * Bauman  2011
PETSc LU doesn't work in parallel
Adding a configurable "unique_id" to DofObject.  Currently works for SerialMesh and ParallelMesh
need #include <sstream> for new libmesh_write_traceout() implementation - Oracle caught this
libmesh_write_traceout macro replaced by libMesh::write_traceout() function.
Adding libmesh_common.C for a place to hold the macro functions.
Automake junk associated with adding a new file.
The libmesh_stop macro is now converted to a function.
ability to clear extra ghost elems and switch it over to using add
Factoring out common parts of macros.
Fixing strange filename due to unexpected behavior of std::stringstream.
implement  EpetraVector<T>::conjugate()  which is a no-op.

rbOOmit change: There was a bug for complex-values in RBConstruction::enrich_RB_space which meant that basis functions were not orthogonal. Here we commit the simple bug fix and also add some debugging info to reduced_basis_ex1 and reduced_basis_ex7 that prints out the inner products between basis functions to make sure that they are accurately orthogonalized.
rbOOmit change: Another small fix regarding complex-values. This one should not affect anything since the RB_inner_product_matrix is not used in complex mode at the moment.
rbOOmit change: if --enable-complex  write out truth solution using GMV instead of exodus since exodus doesn't work with --enable-complex at the moment.
rbOOmit change: Removed incorrect libmesh_conj in calculation of truth_outputs in RBConstruction::truth_solve.
additional includes required for recent macro refactoring.
More enum types supported by string_to_enum
rbOOmit change: Added RBConstruction::set_rb_construction_parameters so that we can set parameters without using an input text file.
rbOOmit change: Cleaned up a few things from the previous commit.
Include <time.h> for strptime() to avoid warning.
fix for MPI-2.  Openmpi-1.7.2 has started complaining about deprecated MPI-1 functions
avoid MPI-1 deprecated features when MPI_VERSION>=2
refactoring StandardType<VectorValue<T> > to be mpi-2 compliant
Have a working MPI-2 VectorValue<> implementation  need to check other types and MPI implementations.
Merge branch 'master' of ssh://github.com/libMesh/libmesh into adjoint_dirichlet
Properly clear old constraints when recalculating
Fix FEMFunction projection bug reported by Manav Bhatia.
adding virgin 4.3.0 tree  minus cmake bits
silent rules  disable tests requiring network access by default
fix for build_testsets false & in-tree builds
We can initialize based on a non-closed vector
Remove overzealous asserts  print all constraints
Moved linear solution monitor up from NewtonSolver to DiffSolver
Add residual and iteration count to LinearSolutionMonitor  BACKWARDS INCOMPATIBLE CHANGE!
Add element id from libMesh to the vtk files
Added version guards for solve results in PetscDiffSolver according to Roys suggestions
Add capability to append data to Exodus files.
Complete patch of correction of vtkSmartPointer usage
allow a Communicator object to toggle between default and synchronous send operations.
extend test coverage to both DEFAULT and SYNCHRONOUS communication modes
Improve error message when trying to write mixed element meshes with Exodus.
Adding current_filename and sanity checks to ExodusII_IO.
Factor out common code from the write_nodal_data and write_nodal_data_discontinuous functions.
Adding capability to output an Exodus file in transient_ex1.
Fix up transient_ex2 IO: * Write to VTK by default  fall back on GMV if VTK is not available. * Use stringstream instead of sprintf.
Check for existing info records before writing.
Properly link config files for VPATH builds
Throw a file error when GetPot can't open a file
Adding _timestep_offset to hopefully avoid overwriting data when appending.
Indenting according to usual libmesh conventions.
Handle the SNES_CONVERGED_ITERATING case to avoid compiler warnings.
Adding additional logic so that ghosted element unique ids are exchanged when using Parallel Mesh
Fix for VPATH make check on misc ex2
Making enableFPE() public so that users can toggle it during the run
Updated Dirichlet constraints to handle nodes
Allow heterogenous constraints w/ non-primal rhs
One more fix for the refactor
Move FEMap constructor to C file  use default constructors for std::vectors.
Heterogeneous adjoint BCs support in ARefEE
Added edge BC support to BoundaryInfo  and impose Dirichlet boundary constraints on edges.
Updated systems_of_equations_ex6 to impose a node and edge Dirichlet boundary condition.
Allow user to install their own PETSc monitors
Fix overzealous assertion in Nedelec elements
This patch fixes the assertions seen with parallel mesh in parallel when unique_ids are enabled
Read the number of global variables present in the Exodus file when we read the header  and don't try to initialize the global variables if there are already some global variables present.
Properly link input files for VPATH builds
Revert "Adding _timestep_offset to hopefully avoid overwriting data when appending."
Handling "blank" entity names in XDA format
Avoid reinitializing element variables when appending to Exodus files.
Bug fix - Reading unique IDs from XDA/XDR should be determined by what's encoded in the file  not how libmesh is configured
Also read the block information when appending.
Add configure option to enable/disable library warnings.
Result of running bootstrap after new --enable-warnings option added
minimum expected update required for intel-14.
Updating XDR interface to be compatible with OSX 10.9.
Include config.h so that HAVE_STRLCAT has a chance to be defined.
Fixing a nasty long-standing indexing bug in FE::shape_second_deriv() for LAGRANGE and L2_LAGRANGE elements!
Fixing bug that prevented d2phidxidzeta_map from ever being computed.
Fixing up warnings found in bibtex files.
Compute second derivatives of tri-linear shape functions on HEX8s.
Adding comm arguments to PetscVector constructors.
Remove unnecessary tellg()/seekg() in GetPot::_skip_whitespace() Seemed to fix weird behavior on Apple clang compiler...
Fixing infinite while-loop silliness in GetPot.
Start for/if scope brackets on new line.
At least three spaces between function definitions.
No comments between function declaration and opening brace.
Removing arbitrary spacing from class declarations.

Updating references: * Botti  2013. * Adding WSSSPE paper. * Adding Tonks  2013b. * Adding Medvedev  2012. * Adding Carlson  2013. * Adding Teague  2013 thesis. * Adding Tonks  2013 Tech report. * Adding Tonks Acta Materialia paper. * Adding Butterfield senior thesis.
Make separate PDFs for each section and combine them together later.
invoke METIS only on processor 0  then broadcast the partitioning
change the vectormap<> to be from id to id rather than ptr to id  in order to save space on 64-bit machines with 32-bit indices
Fixing bug in parallel mesh meta-data broadcast
construct the CSR graph representation in-place
put the CSR graph in its own header file  so ParMETIS can eventually contain one.
Fix 0.7.0 bug where we didn't write out the header indicating how many sidesets to read
Updating ElemBCData to make it work with both Node types and Elem types
If element variables already exist in the Exodus file when calling initialize_element_variables()  check to ensure they match the requested variable names exactly.
Ensure that the names of the global variables requested for initialization match the names of the global variables already in the file.
Make the initialize_xyz_variables() interfaces the same.
Replacing explicit calls to ex_put_var_names() with unified interface.
Also wrap the call to ex_put_var_param() in write_var_names().
Return if no global variables to write.
Return if no nodal variables to write.
Disable xdr when we don't support xdr
All the new helper functions should be private.
Make Exodus reader respect the numbering in elem_num_map.
Another attempt at fixing unique ids in parallel mesh

Merge write_elements() fixes into write_elements_discontinuous() but note: * I don't have code that tests write_elements_discontinuous() * I don't know how write_elements_discontinuous() is supposed to differ   from write_elements() * It doesn't look like it's writing out the elem_num_map correctly:   it gets overwritten for each block.
Make Exodus reader respect the numbering in node_num_map.

Intel 13 warns about "invalid narrowing conversion" when a constant like 3./8. is stored in a float  but only in code that uses "curly-bracket initialization".  So we typically only see these warnings in libmesh when creating C-sytle arrays.
Explicitly instantiate single-Point version of FE::inverse_map() to try and satisfy Intel 14 compilers.
Nagler 2013 preprint is back with DOI.
Fixing error in netcdf that apparently only affects OSX 10.6.8.
Better fix for Snow Leopard only bug
Trying one more possible fix in daputil.c that may work for Snow Leopard.
Patch from Jed Brown fixing PetscDMLibMesh on Petsc >= 3.5.
Build the proper filename string based on the total number of processors present in a run.
Checking for NULL before deleting not necessary.
Added warnings in XDR and ExodusII I/O that edge boundary condition info is not supported by the format.
Added warning to Nemesis_IO about edge boundary IDs not being written out. Also  updated comments in boundary_info.h to emphasize that edge-based boundary IDs should only be used in 3D.

Added extra warnings for Exodus and Nemesis about edge BCs not being written out. These warnings are relevant when we do write_equation_systems. The other ones were called when we just wrote the mesh.
Adding insert_node() interface at the MeshBase level.
Revert "Make Exodus reader respect the numbering in node_num_map."
Revert "Make Exodus reader respect the numbering in elem_num_map."
Adding Exodus node_num_map and elem_num_map stuff back in.
Adding second derivatives for first order LAGRANGE shape functions on PRISMs.
Fixed compilation errors for --disable-amr due to recent node and edge boundary condition patch.
Fixes for Xdr I/O with varying id sizes
Adding libmesh_not_implemented() placeholders for PRISM15 in shape()  shape_deriv()  and shape_second_deriv() functions.

- Updated assignment operator in BoundaryInfo to copy over edge data. - Updated MeshTools::Modification::change_boundary_id to modify edge and node boundary data. - Updated SerialMesh::stitching_helper to copy over edge and node boundary data.
Adding PRISM15 shape function second derivatives.
Making refspace nodes match the basis function definitions for the PYRAMID5.
Simplify zeta derivatives of PYRAMID5 significantly.
Fix ARefEE regression w/no heterog adjoint BCs
Updating our subset of Boost to 1.55.0
Adding test code which should be used for generating boost dependencies.
Disable multithreading when using Boost's pool allocator  otherwise Boost.Pool is no longer a header-only library.
Clang "helpfully" warns that this function is unused when blocked storage is disabled.
Clang warns about declaring nested anonymous structs  so ... don't do that  I guess?
Added options for triangle in TriangleInterface
Add subdomain id from libMesh to the vtk files
rbOOmit change: Updated EIM code to pass the element that the evaluation occurs on to the parametrized function.
Add PYRAMID14 to all relevant branches in build_cube().
rbOOmit change: update to previous commit to allow the case where the same element is selected in multiple EIM interpolation points.
Add support for writing 14-node pyramid elements to Exodus files.
Updating documentation with what I've found about the PYRAMID14 element thus far.

Adding PYRAMID14 support in miscellaneous places: * string_to_enum() * Various functions in fe_lagrange.C * Quadrature initialization routines * FEAbstract::on_reference_element() * lagrange_nodal_soln() helper function * FEAbstract::get_refspace_nodes() * FEInterface::max_order() * l2_lagrange_n_dofs() * monomial_n_dofs() * xyz_n_dofs() * Quality::valid() * ElementTypes::basic_name() * ElementTypes::name() * QGrid::init_3D()
Add one_pyramid14.xda to the list of files to install.
Modifications have been made to correct behavior of h-adaptivity with higher order SZABAB and BERNSTEIN:
added comm for mesh constructor in RBEIMEvaluation
just pass vectors through to the PETSc interface
Avoid narrowing warnings when initializing arrays.
Make libmesh-config --ldflags return whatever libmesh_LDFLAGS was set to during configure.
use static scheduling and remove unnecessary omp_get_thread_num
guard the new add_vector implementation properly
rbOOmit change: Removed inverse_map from RBEIMAssembly::evaluate_basis_function. Should be a significant optimization for large systems.
rbOOmit change: Added logging in RBEIMAssembly::evaluate_basis_function
rbOOmit change: Further optimized RBEIMAssembly::evaluate_basis_function by storing FE objects. This means we benefit from caching in the calls to reinit.
Updating citations: * Fuentes  2013b * Rong  2013 * Fixing Dodd III * Tonks  2014
Allow TimeSolver tolerances relative to first step
Allow ExodusII_IO to have empty variable list
Adding code to detect the value of PETSC_VERSION_RELEASE during configure.
Fall back to the old PETSC_VERSION_LESS_THAN macro for old PETScs.
Don't pollute other code with local macro definitions
Adding 'partition_agnostic' argument to equation systems read and write to be able to turn off renumbering
specify serial tests when using newer automakes
cast to a std::size_t rather than assume  fixes cygwin
include Hilbert/Algorithm.hpp to resolve linking on cygwin
updating automake version number to v0.9.3-rc1
updating automake version number to v0.9.3-rc2
add 'global' comm world using functions for backporting
fixup examples to try not to use the global comm
incorporate upstream openmp autoconf update  and set enableopenmp=no when the upstream test fails for proper option reporting
configure update for previous m4 change
